result.execSummary:
The defendant Jade Alexia Mobley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jade Alexia Mobley is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Jade Alexia Mobley was found guilty of Negligent Operation of Motor Vehicle, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.01(1).
  • Jade Alexia Mobley was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: DE requests expunction.  If DE completes probation successfully and w/o violations, DE write letter to court expressing need and why court should grant.  Court may set hearing and grant expunction if stisfied.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
*   Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay the surcharge, notice given to def. in court.
Perform  30    hours of community service for a public agency or a nonprofit charitable organization.  May not have contact with Mr Pope outside court setting, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jade Alexia Mobley

records.addlTxt: Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Shamali.   Clerk HMcBride.   State is compliant with victim rights notification. Matter resolved. Amended Info filed.  Reading waived.  On state's motion, ct 2 is dismissed.  DE enters guilty plea to cts 1 and 3.   Court finds DE guilty of cts 1 and 3.   Ct 1 - court withholds sentence and places DE on probation for 1 year with conditions; ct 3 - court withholds sentence and places DE on probation for 1 year with conditions concurrent to ct 1;  DE to submit DNA sample and pay surcharge.    DE requests expunction. If DE completes probation without successfully and withouth violations, DE write letter to court expressing need and why court should grant. Court may set hearing and grant expunction if satisfied.    Appeal rights given.

Defendant, Jade Alexia Mobley, appeared with Attorney Chad A Shamali.  Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found.  Bound over to Br 1.  Information filed; reading waived.  Not guilty plea entered.  Branch 1 Scheduling Order completed and given to Attorney.  Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 24, 2022 at 10:00 am.
filed by Atty. Chad Shamali  kmk
